abstracts.cdata!:
This results profile talks about the
            power sector in Georgia. With support from the International
            Development Association (IDA) in the Electricity Market
            Support Project, the government has transformed the power
            sector into a financially viable, modernized, and
            functioning sector which delivers an almost uninterrupted
            power supply to its customers. The improved power system
            reliability has benefitted every citizen and household, and
            public and private entities, especially the service,
            industrial and productive sectors.

693613.trustfund:
TF040338-EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA REGION
            - POWER (ECONOMIC & SECTOR WORK, PREPARA,TF035958-GEORGIA - POWER PRIVATIZATION,TF025146-PHRD-POWER & GAS RESTRUCTURING

abstracts.cdata!:
The Electricity Market Support Project
            aims to improve reliability and efficiency of electricity
            supply, and improve financial and corporate management in
            the wholesale electricity market. The project contains seven
            components. The first component will support the
            rehabilitation and upgrade of metering of electricity flows
            in the transmission network. The second component will
            support the rehabilitation and upgrade of system control.
            The third component will support the rehabilitation and
            upgrade of telecommunication, including installation of the
            necessary communication equipment. The fourth component will
            support the rehabilitation of selected transmission
            substations. The fifth component will support the management
            of information systems by installing the computerized
            management information system at Electrogadatsema. The sixth
            component will bring the necessary market and management
            expertise and improve the commercial and technical
            performance of the system by signing the management
            contracts with international firms to manage the Wholesale
            Electricity Market, and the transmission and dispatch
            companies. The seventh component will support consulting
            services and incremental operating costs.
